problem:
ZL = "j*w*L"
You just saw a derivation of the impedance of a resistor and the impedance of a capacitor. You are to derive the impedance of an inductor. In the space provided below write an algebraic expression in terms of angular frequency \(\omega\) and inductance \(L\) for the ratio of the complex amplitude of the voltage across an inductor to the complex amplitude of the current through the inductor. (As usual, use \(w\) for \(\omega\) in your expression.)
